titleStmt.title: Von Ludwig Wittgenstein an George Edward Moore, [November 1947]
titleStmt.author: Wittgenstein, Ludwig

sourceDesc.p: Original bei Timothy Moore; Kopie im BA. Publiziert (Letters, S. 188; deutsch: Briefe, S. 226; Cambridge Letters, S. 330; WiC, S. 417).

list.item: 2007/06: Conversion from Folio Flat File to XML

div.p: This is only to say that I've found the missing M.S.S.. Miss Anscombe had not just one copy, as I believed, & I found part of a M.S. in my own possession, & together & with the bit you have the three copies are complete. I needn't say I'm glad.
I also wish to say that I enjoyed very much seeing you these last 5 weeks. I think, in a way, more than I used to. I wish you lots of good luck!
P.S. I shall give Drury your good wishes. You didn't actually tell me to, but I know it's all right with you.
